availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Barclay Harrison (Logan County, Kentucky, sheriff)

body.p: Logan County, Kentucky, sheriff. Kentucky native. Son of Carter H. Harrison and Margaret Edwards Harrison. Married to Jennie Todd Harrison in Davidson County, Tennessee, on June 16, 1853. Father of John Harrison, Henry Harrison, and Fanny Harrison. Sheriff in Logan County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned nineteen enslaved persons in Logan County in 1860. Sheriff in Logan County in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Logan County, District 1, p. 485.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Logan County, District 1, p. 386 B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Logan County, Russellville, p. 498 A.
Tennessee State Marriages, 1780-2002, Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN, Davidson County Marriages, 1838-1864.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #23016.
"Thomas Barclay Harrison, Sr. (1822-1913)," Find A Grave, Memorial #157468360, accessed October 31, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/157468360.
